body: i'm thankful to recommend checking out [caroline moss's twitter](https://twitter.com/socarolinesays), where yesterday she posted [a drawing of what she sees in her mind when she thinks of the days of the week](https://twitter.com/socarolinesays/status/994381125601648641) and then asked other people to do the same thing. i'm thankful to have done [one representing what they look like to me](https://twitter.com/fakeirl/status/994385519940456448), and i'm thankful for all the other people who did, since within the very simple prompt (represent the seven days of the week as you see them), there is room for so many variations and it's interesting to think about how those variations obliquely reflect something inside of the people who made them about what their weeks are like, with [semi-circles](https://twitter.com/socarolinesays/status/994381125601648641) and [circles](https://twitter.com/carriemelago/status/994382312946241537) and [bars](https://twitter.com/hootzpeterson/status/994386361334620161) and [lines](https://twitter.com/Swainsch/status/994385382153256962) and [spikes](https://twitter.com/whereskayleigh/status/994383010941358081) and [spines](https://twitter.com/howellisms/status/994390970765541378).
